basics.name: Kunle Sunday Oguntoye
basics.label: Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: Innovative researcher with a strong background in civil engineering, artificial intelligence, and computer vision. Pursuing a PhD in Intelligent Infrastructure Engineering at Iowa State University, I develop predictive models and multimodal sensing systems for pavement performance, infrastructure monitoring, and digital twin applications. My expertise spans machine learning applications, UAV-based data collection, and geospatial analytics—bridging data science and engineering to enhance decision-making, safety, and sustainability.

work.name: Iowa State University
work.summary: Research assistant developing AI/ML solutions for infrastructure monitoring and pavement performance prediction.
highlights: Developed high-speed predictive analytics models for forecasting pavement conditions using multimodal data
Created web application using React and Django for utility engineers to generate underground utility maps, reducing wait times by 60%
Developed automated object detection framework using Faster R-CNN and YOLO for drone-based utility asset detection

work.name: Iowa State University
work.summary: Full-stack geospatial platform development and drone operations for infrastructure assessment.
highlights: Migrated monolithic application to event-driven AWS architecture (ECS Fargate, S3, EventBridge), reducing upload times from 5+ to <5 minutes and costs by 90%
Developed automated ArcGIS Python toolboxes for DEM analysis, reducing inspection time by 70%
Licensed FAA remote pilot conducting UAV operations for infrastructure data collection

work.name: Musco Sport Lighting
work.summary: MLOps pipeline development and computer vision model deployment for people monitoring systems.
highlights: Designed end-to-end MLOps pipeline using Mlflow, TensorBoard, and AWS, improving GPU utilization by 15%
Increased data annotation pipeline efficiency by 30% through optimized algorithms
Conducted hyperparameter tuning on YOLOv5 for improved object detection

work.name: Seflam SGI
work.summary: Project management for oil and gas engineering projects in Nigeria.
highlights: Championed 3D modeling of mechanical and safety equipment at Nigeria LNG facility using LiDAR, cutting inspection time by 50%
Selected as top company representative at 2021 National Oil and Gas Conference

work.name: Nexant Consulting LLP
work.summary: Quality control and construction inspection for civil engineering projects.
highlights: Led on-site quality control for 50+ material batches, reducing rejection rates by 18%
Conducted 40+ phased inspections, resolving 25 critical deviations before final acceptance

education.area: Intelligent Infrastructure Engineering and Computer Science

Thesis: A Practical Framework for Automatic Underground Utility Mapping
